sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Lévy C curve.
message_1:
What is the Hausdorff dimension of the Lévy C curve?

(Note: the Hausdorff dimension is a measure of the "dimensionality" of a fractal object.)
message_2:
The Hausdorff dimension of the Lévy C curve can be calculated using the formula:

Hausdorff dimension (D) = log(N) / log(s)

where N is the number of self-similar pieces and s is the scaling factor.

For the Lévy C curve, it is constructed by replacing each line segment with two segments, each 1/sqrt(2) times the length of the original segment. Therefore, the scaling factor s is sqrt(2), and the number of self-similar pieces N is 2.

So, the Hausdorff dimension (D) of the Lévy C curve is:

D = log(2) / log(sqrt(2))

D ≈ 2

The Hausdorff dimension of the Lévy C curve is approximately 2.
